greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the unique real number x whose Engel expansion is the Lucas sequence.
formula: x = Sum_{n >= 1} 1/(Product_{1 <= i <= n} L(i)), where L(i) is the i-th Lucas number.
mathematica: Lucas[n_Integer?Positive] := Lucas[n] = Lucas[n-1] + Lucas[n-2]; Lucas[1] = 1; Lucas[2] = 3; N[Sum[1/Product[Lucas[i], {i, n}], {n, 500}], 100]

digits = 100; Clear[x]; x[m_] := x[m] = N[Sum[1/Product[LucasL[i], {i, 1, n}], {n, 1, m}], digits+5]; m = 10; While[x[m] != x[m-1], m++]; RealDigits[x[m], 10, digits][[1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 20 2015 *)
results.author: _Ryan Propper_, Dec 11 2004
